name: 喻沐英
objective: 教導學生閱讀囊括全球議題的文章，並藉由文章的內容作技巧的訓練，字彙的建構，語言的解析，及思維的啟發。課中延展活動將閱讀內容與聽力、會話、寫作做進一步的連結，並引導學生將所學做有效的應用。
schedule:
First Semester: Fall 2010
Week
1. Introduction / English activities--Unit 7 Free Running
2. Unit 7. Free Running: What is parkour or free runninng?
3. Unit 7. Free Running: participles as adfectives; the gerund as subject and object
4. Unit 8. The Tomato: Why are tomatoes popular?
5. Unit 8. The Tomato: verbs with gerunds;verbs with infinitives;verbs with gerunds or infinititves
6. Unit 9. Hair: Do hairstyles always change?
7. Unit 9. Hair: passive voice: present perfect and future
8. Class midterm exam
9. English activies/ Unit 10 Machu Picchu
10. Unit 10 Machu Picchu: What is Machu Picchu?
11. Unit 11 Einstein: Who was Albert Einstein?
Test: Listening Two.
12. Unit 11 Einstein: defining and nondefining adfective clauses
13. Toeic exam practice / [Check it Out] Review activities.
14. Unit 12 Riddles: What is riddle?
15. Review Tests & English activities
16. Unit 12 Riddles: reported questions and requests
17. ExamProficiency Test
18. Class Final
scorePolicy: Assessment for the course will comprise up to three demonstrations, as well as assignment and tests, which will be given at the instructor’s discretion. The grade will be a cumulative average of all demonstrations, in class assignments, homework, tests, and attendance.
materials:
A. Barton, Laurie and Carolyn Dupaquier Sardinas. North Star 3 :Reading and Writing. 3rd ed. White Plains: Pearson, 2009.
B. Solorzano, Helen S. and Jennifer P. L. Schmidt. North Star 3: Listening and Speaking. 3rd ed. White Plains: Pearson, 2009.
